intro: Cyclopia genistoides var. teretifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf goldcup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and terete, giving it its specific variety name, and it is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
